column4: I need help with getting full resolution with my nVidia 6800 GT
I tried everything on https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FixVideoResolutionHowto
can someone please help me?
what driver are you using? binary or free?
I think the binary
try with the nvidia-settings program
it says nVidia everytime before GDM starts
nice GUI and all ;)
tried it already, I couldn't find anything
you didint' find the program? or what?
no, I found it, it just doesn't let me do anything of use
strange... allways worked for me... maybe you need to launch it with gksu??
hmm, tried gksu, gives me the same functionality as it gave me just running sudo
what should I be looking for?
in the section "X Server Display Configuration" ypou can set the desired resolution color deph etc

it has X Server Information, X Server Display Configuration, X SCreen 0 > X Server Color Correction, X Server XVideo Settings, Cursor SHadow, OpenGL Settings, OpenGL/GLX Information, Antialiasing Settings; GPU 0  - (GeForce 6800 GT) >> Thermal Monitor, CRT-0 - (@@@), and nvidia-settings configuration :P
X Server Display Configuration <<< Here
the resolution only gives me the "Auto" option
and the menu next to it is greyed out
mine is not greyed and there's where you choose the res (the auto is for refresh rate)
perhaps I ran the wrong command to initiate the nvidia drivers?
dunno
thanks for the help, but I think I'll have to keep digging around forums or something
